result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gregory A. Mortensen

records.addlTxt:
10:00 AM Defendant Gregory A. Mortensen in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Mulligan II in court for Gregory A. Mortensen.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Set for preliminary hearing. Time limits waived. Bond set in 22CF89 to cover this case as well.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
10:10 AM Defendant Gregory A. Mortensen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Aaron B Marcoux in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Atty Thomas-Schmidt makes a special appearance for the defendant. Defendant does qualify for a PD-one has not been appointed as of today's date. Court questions the defendant. Defendant and State would request an adjournment. Granted.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
